column4: Hi guys. Today i downloaded and installed The newest ubuntu on my computer...
But i have a problem... i cant find TCL nor Building Essentials
where can i get it?
Open a package manager (System -> Administration -> Synaptic), or if you prefer, go to Terminal, and install the 'build-essential' and 'tcl' packages.
i cant find it in there
How about "apt-get install build-essential"?
Pastebin your sources.list please?
i'm just restarting my ubuntu pc again... i'll be back in 15 minutes... need to go help my mother
ok i'm back. When I Do "Sudo apt-get install build-essential" it says "Could not find package"
Can you try "sudo apt-get update"?
i will need the internet for this right?
Yes.
how much CAP will this update need?
I have no idea what does 'CAP' mean, but apt-get update only re-downloads the package lists, shouldn't be more than a few megs. (Probably less.)
isnt there a place where i can download the Build essentials and TCL without doing the "update" function
http://packages.ubuntu.com/ , but why do you need that?
Um, the 'update' command only downloads the package _list_
Did you do 'apt-get update'?
Ah.
Can you download them from packages.ubuntu.com?
Using another computer.
isnt there a command which i can install lib6 or something like that?
